quoteFirst: Half the Townfield had been cut off, a couple of years ago, to furnish a small park or pleasure-ground; but looking across the open space to the north-west, they could see the old part of the town in its hollow; the old church of the parish on ground almost as high as the Townfield itself; the gilded spire of the town-hall rising ambitiously from the hollow (it chimed
quoteLast: with mellow tone as they stood there), and all the other churches and chapels and public buildings strewn here and there about the town. A great cloud of smoke came up and dimmed the air; on every side was a fringe of long chimneys; different big factories were familiar features in the landscape, and formed landmarks to Mary and her brother--had formed landmarks to them from infancy.
title: Probation
author: Fothergill, Jessie, 1851-1891

quoteLast: ," he said. "Mr. Mellish dines at seven. Can you call at the house, say at nine, this evening? You shall then have all the assistance it is in our power to give you."

Aurora Floyd, Vol. 3

quoteFirst: The artificers landed on the rock this morning at a
quoteLast: , and remained at work five hours.  The cooking apparatus being now in full operation, all hands had breakfast on the beacon at the usual hour, and remained there throughout the day.

quoteFirst: Then I had to pay a boy a levy to put the trunks in the baggage car. In the meantime I took Sis into the Depot Hotel. It was only a
quoteLast: , and we had to wait until seven.... We started in good spirits, but did not get here until nearly three o'clock. Sissy coughed none at all. When we got to the wharf it was raining hard.
title: The Home Life of Poe
author: Weiss, Susan Archer Talley, 1835-

quoteFirst: , and this morning a quarter to one!! and no power of quizzing can move our worthy major to let us take it easily, though I don't scruple to tell him that he has sold his shadow or his soul to the evil powers, and forfeited the power of sleep, he is such a restless animal! We breakfast at seven, or even
quoteLast: , constantly, and dine at seven P. M.; so one has a fair opportunity of practising abstinence, as I rigidly abstain from eating in the mean time, or drinking.
title:
Twelve Years of a Soldier's Life in India

quoteFirst: “I was awakened, and arose about twenty minutes ago. It was about a
quoteLast: , and I was getting ready to sew. Then, for an instant, I noticed that my lamp was going out, and I ended by not seeing anything more. At the same moment I felt my waist clasped, strongly held by an invisible arm.
title: From India to the planet Mars: A study of a case of somnambulism with glossolalia
author: Flournoy, Théodore, 1854-1920; Vermilye, Daniel B. [Translator]

quoteLast: , they went through the funny, merry little barn house toward the bedrooms.
